intro: Monticalia alcidiphylla, commonly known as the silky monticalia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually elliptical and covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in moist forest understories.
